analyzed: dakṣa deśe ca tam dadyāt anyat tu vāma deśake  madhyamā anāmikā aṃguṣṭhaiḥ aṃguli agreṇa nārada
translated: The incense should be offered on the right side, while the other offerings are made on the left side.

analyzed: dadyāt ca vimalam gaṃdham mūlamaṃtreṇa sādhakaḥ
translated: O Narada! The pure incense should be offered with the thumb, middle finger and ring finger, at the tip of the fingers, by the practitioner, with the root mantra.

original: yathā gaṃdhastathā vipra dhūpaṃ dadyād vicakṣaṇaḥ /
analyzed: yathā gaṃdhaḥ tathā vipra dhūpam dadyāt vicakṣaṇaḥ
translated: O Brahmin! Just as with the incense, the wise one should offer the lamp,

analyzed: madhyamā anāmikābhyām tu madhya parvaṇi deśikaḥ
translated: with the middle and ring fingers, at the middle joint, by the preceptor.
O Brahmin Rishi! Holding the lamp with the tip of the thumb, it should be offered.

original: tat tolanaṃ tridhā kṛtvā gāyatryā mūlamaṃtrataḥ //🔽tatvākhya mudrayā vipra naivedyaṃ vinivedayet /
analyzed: tat tolanam tridhā kṛtvā gāyatryā mūlamaṃtrataḥ  mudrayā vipra naivedyam vinivedayet
translated: That lamp should be offered three times, with the Gayatri and root mantra,🔽and the food offering should be presented with the mudra called Tattva.

original: mūlenācamanaṃ dadyāt tāṃbūlaṃ tattvamudrayā //🔽puṣpaṃ vā yadi vā patraṃ neṣṭaṃ sarvamadhomukham /
analyzed: mūlena ācamanam dadyāt tāṃbūlam tattva mudrayā  puṣpam vā yadi vā patram na iṣṭam sarvam adhomukham
translated: Water for rinsing the mouth should be offered with the root mantra, and betel nut with the Tattva mudra.🔽Flowers or leaves should not be offered with the face downwards.

original: tālena na pūjitāṃ ghaṃṭāṃ vādayen guggulaṃ dahet //
analyzed: tālena na pūjitām ghaṃṭām vādayet guggulam dahet
translated: The bell should not be rung without being worshipped with the tala mantra, and guggula should not be burnt.

original: idānīṃ śṛṇu viprarṣe dhūpanirūpanaṃ mama /🔽guggulaṃ śaralaṃ dārupatraṃ malayasaṃbhavam //
analyzed: idānīm śṛṇu viprarṣe dhūpa nirūpanam mama  guggulam śaralam dārupatram malayasaṃbhavam
translated: Now listen, O Brahmin Rishi, to my description of incense.🔽Guggula, shala tree, wood, leaves from the Malaya mountain,

analyzed: hrīveram agurum kuṣṭham guḍam sarjarasam ghanam
translated: Hrivera, aguru, kushtha, jaggery, sarja resin, and resin -
Haritaki, nails, Laksha, Jata, Masha, and Shailja,

original: ṣoḍaśāṃgaṃ vidurdhūpaṃ daive paitre ca karmaṇi /
analyzed: ṣoḍaśa aṃgam viduḥ dhūpam daive paitre ca karmaṇi
translated: They know this sixteen-ingredient incense to be used in both divine and ancestral rituals.
Honey, fist, ghee, fragrance, Guggulu, Guru, Shailja,

analyzed: śaralam sihla siddhārtham daśāṃgodhūpaḥ ucyate
translated: Sharala, Sihla, and Siddha-Artha are said to be the ten-ingredient incense.
Guggulu mixed with white ghee, honey, and Guru Chandana,

original: ṣaḍaṃgadhūme tat tu sarvadeva priyaṃ sadā /
analyzed: ṣaḍaṃga dhūme tat tu sarva deva priyam sadā
translated: This six-ingredient incense is always dear to all gods.

analyzed: guggulu aguru uśīram ca śarkarā madhu candanaiḥ
translated: Guggulu, Aguru, Ushira, sugar, honey, and Chandana,

analyzed: dhūpayet ājya saṃmiśraiḥ nīcais daivasya deśikaḥ
translated: The priest should offer incense mixed with ghee to the deity below.

original: iti te kathitaṃ vipra praśnottaraṃ mayā tava /
analyzed: iti te kathitam vipra praśna uttaram mayā tava
translated: Thus, O Brahmin, I have told you the answer to your question.

analyzed: kim adhunā pravakṣyāmi tat me kathaya nārada
translated: What shall I explain now? Tell me that, Narada.

analyzed: iti nailalohitīye śrī kālānalataṃtre upacārakathanat nāma viṃśatitamaḥ paṭalaḥ
translated: Thus ends the twenty-first chapter named Description of Worship in the Nila-Lohita Kalana-Tantra.

analyzed: uvāca
translated: Shree Narada said:

analyzed: nīlalohita he nātha girija ānanda varddhana
translated: O Nila-Lohita, O Lord, the enhancer of the joy of the daughter of the mountain,

analyzed: tvad prasādāt śrutam sarvam siddhi lakṣmyāḥ arcanam mayā
translated: By your grace, I have heard everything about the worship of Siddhi Lakshmi.

analyzed: yoktā rahasya mālā ca nīlalohita tām vada
translated: Please tell me about the secret garland and the Nila-Lohita state.

original: kasya kasya bhavenmālā kasyaiva kāmadā phalāḥ //
analyzed: kasya kasya bhavet mālā kasya eva kāma dā phalāḥ
translated: Whose garland will be of what? Whose will be the fruit that grants desires?

analyzed: sarvam nigada bhagavat nīlalohita
translated: O Lord, having examined all this, please tell me, O Nilaloha.

analyzed: śrī nīlalohitaḥ uvāca
translated: Sri Nilaloha said:

analyzed: śṛṇu vatsa mahā vāho nārada brahma naṃdana
translated: Listen, O son of the great sage Narada and Brahma,

original: śraddhayā tava viprarṣe prītirme jāyate tvayi //
analyzed: śraddhayā tava viprarṣe prītiḥ me jāyate tvayi
translated: O Brahmin Rishi, faith arises in me towards you.

original: sarvāsāmeva devīnāṃ mālāṃ vakṣyāmi tāṃ śṛṇu /
analyzed: sarvāsām eva devīnām mālām vakṣyāmi tām śṛṇu
translated: I will tell you the garland of all the goddesses, listen to that.

original: tataḥ paścyācca tāsāṃ tu saṃskāraṃ pavravīmi te //🔽rudrākṣaśaṃkhapadmākṣa putrajīvikamauktikaiḥ /🔽sphāṭikairmaṇiratnaiśca sauvarṇairvidrumaistathā //
analyzed: tatas paścyāt ca tāsām tu saṃskāram te               sphāṭikaiḥ maṇi ratnaiḥ ca sauvarṇaiḥ vidrumaiḥ tathā
translated: Then after that, I will tell you the consecration of those.🔽For a householder, the rosary should be made of Rudraksha, conch, lotus seeds, Putrajiva, pearls,🔽crystal, gems, gold, coral,

analyzed: rajataiḥ kuśa mūlaiḥ ca gṛhasthasya akṣa mālikā
translated: silver, and roots of Kusha grass.

original: aṃgulīgaṇanādekaṃ parvaṇāṣṭaguṇaṃ smṛtam //🔽putrajīvairdaśaguṇaṃ śataṃ śaṃkhaiḥ sahasrakam /
analyzed: aṃgulī gaṇanāt ekam parvaṇā aṣṭaguṇam smṛtam  putrajīvaiḥ daśaguṇam śatam śaṃkhaiḥ sahasrakam
translated: Counting on the fingers is said to be one, on the joints eight times,🔽on Putrajiva ten times, on conch shells one hundred, on coral and gem stones one thousand,

original: pravālairmaṇiratnaiśca daśasahasrakaṃ smṛtam //🔽tadeva sphāṭikaṃ proktaṃ mauktikairlakṣamucyate /
analyzed: pravālaiḥ maṇi ratnaiḥ ca daśa sahasrakam smṛtam  tat eva sphāṭikam proktam mauktikaiḥ lakṣam ucyate
translated: on coral and gem stones ten thousand is said.🔽That same rosary made of crystal is said to be one lakh with pearls,

analyzed: padmākṣaiḥ daśa lakṣam syāt koṭiḥ ucyate
translated: one lakh with lotus seeds, and one crore with white coral is said.
A rosary of a hundred million Rudraksha beads strung together with Kusha grass knots is infinite.

analyzed: sarvaiḥ viracitā mālā nṛṇām mukti phala pradā
translated: A rosary made of all these beads grants liberation to men.

original: yasyā yasyāśca yā mālā idānīṃ śṛṇu tad dvija /
analyzed: yasyāḥ yasyāḥ ca yā mālā idānīm śṛṇu tat dvija
translated: Now listen to the beads of which rosary for which deity, O Brahmin.

analyzed: bhairavīnām maham vakṣye mālām sarva samṛddhi dām
translated: I will now tell you the rosary of Bhairavi, which grants all prosperity.

analyzed: suvarṇa racitām mālām sphāṭikīm śaṃkha nirmitām
translated: One should make a rosary of gold, crystal, or conch shell.

analyzed: pravālaiḥ eva vā kuryāt putrajīvam vivarjayet
translated: One should use coral, but avoid Pushara.

original: rudrākṣaṃ caiva bhadrākṣaṃ padmāṃ ca viśeṣataḥ /
analyzed: rudrākṣam ca eva bhadrākṣam padmām ca viśeṣataḥ
translated: Rudraksha, Bhadraksha, and Padma are especially auspicious.

analyzed: tripurāṇām idānīm te vakṣyāmi padmayoni ja
translated: O Lotus-born One, I will now tell you about the beads for Tripura.

analyzed: raktacandana mālā tu bhoga dā mokṣa dā bhavet
translated: A rosary of red sandalwood grants enjoyment and liberation.

analyzed: tripurā yāḥ jape sastā rudra akṣa raktacandanaiḥ
translated: One should recite the mantra of Tripura with Rudraksha and red sandalwood beads.

analyzed: śmaśānaiḥ dhūsturaiḥ mālā jñeyā dhūmāvatī vidhau
translated: A rosary of cremation ground flowers and Dhustura is known as the rosary of Dhumavati.

original: mahāśaṃkhamayī mālā tārā vidyā jape dvija //
analyzed: mahā śaṃkha mayī mālā tārā vidyā jape dvija
translated: O Brahmin, a rosary of large conch shells is recommended for reciting the Tara Vidya.

analyzed: karṇa netra antara stha asthi mahāśaṃkhaḥ prakīrtitaḥ
translated: The bone found in the ear and eye is known as the large conch shell.

analyzed: nava aṃguli asthibhiḥ mālā siddhilakṣmyāḥ prakīrtitāḥ
translated: A rosary of bones nine fingers long is said to be auspicious for Siddhi and Lakshmi.

analyzed: nāḍībhiḥ graṃthanam kāryam mathavā rakta vāsasā
translated: The rosary should be strung with red threads or red cloth.

analyzed: gopanīyā prayatnena jananyā ajāra vat dvija
translated: O Brahmin, it should be carefully concealed like a mother's breasts.

original: bhedena kāmanānāñca mālāṃ vakṣyāmi vai dvija /🔽pannākṣairvihitā mālā śatrūṇāṃ nāśinī matā //
analyzed: bhedena kāmanānām ca mālām vakṣyāmi vai dvija  pannākṣaiḥ vihitā mālā śatrūṇām nāśinī matā
translated: O Brahmin, I will now describe the rosary for different desires.🔽A rosary made with gems is considered destructive of enemies.

analyzed: kuśa graṃthi mayī mālā sarva pāpa praṇāśinī
translated: A rosary made with kuśa grass destroys all sins.

analyzed: putrajīva phalaiḥ kurute putra saṃpadam  nirmita ārūpya mālābhiḥ japa mālā īpsita pradā
translated: A rosary made with putrajīva fruits grants the boon of sons.🔽A rosary made with silver grants the desired fruits of japa.

analyzed: pravālaiḥ vihitā mā prayacchet puṣkaram dhanam
translated: A rosary made with coral grants the wealth of a lotus pond.

original: mahāśaṃkhāpya bhāve ca sphāṭikī mālayā japet /
analyzed: bhāve ca sphāṭikī mālayā japet
translated: In the absence of a rosary made with great conch shells, one should perform japa with a crystal rosary.

original: siddhilakṣmyā jape jñayā vidhireṣa dvijottama //🔽anyonya samarūpāṇi nātisthūlakṛśāni vai /
analyzed: siddhilakṣmyāḥ jape jñayā vidhiḥ eṣa dvijottama  anyonya sama rūpāṇi na ati sthūla kṛśāni vai
translated: O best of Brahmins, this is the method for japa with the rosary of Siddhi Lakshmi.🔽The beads should be of similar shape, not too thick or thin,

analyzed: kīṭa ādibhiḥ aduṣṭāni na jīrṇāni navāni vai
translated: not spoiled by insects, not worn out, and new.

analyzed: saṃkhyā bhedena adhunā te phalam vakṣyāmi nārada
translated: Now, O Narada, I will tell you the fruits according to the different numbers of beads.

analyzed: paṃcāśat maṇibhiḥ mālā vihitā sarva karmasu
translated: A rosary made with fifty beads is suitable for all rituals.

analyzed: akāra ādi kṣakāra aṃtā akṣamālā prakīrttitā
translated: The rosary is said to consist of the letters from a to kṣa.

analyzed: kṣāṃtam meru mukham tantra kalpayet muni sattama
translated: O best of sages, one should perform the Japa of the mantra with the Merumukha Kshanta.

original: anayā sarvamaṃtrāṇāṃ japaḥ sarvasamṛddhidaḥ /🔽nityaṃ japaṃ kare kuryān natu kāmyamavodhanāt //
analyzed: anayā sarva maṃtrāṇām japaḥ sarva samṛddhi daḥ  nityam japam kare kuryāt na tu kāmya mavodhanāt
translated: By this, the Japa of all mantras gives all prosperity.🔽One should always perform the Japa on the hand, not the desired one due to lack of knowledge.

analyzed: kāmyam apikare kuryāt mālā abhāve tathā dvija
translated: Even the desired one should be performed on the hand, O Brahmin, in the absence of a rosary.

analyzed: prasaṃgāt akṣasūtrāṇām vidhānam iha ca ucyate
translated: By the way, the rules for the Aksha-sutras are being stated here.

analyzed: aṣṭottaraśataiḥ sarva siddhiḥ uktā manīṣibhiḥ
translated: The wise have said that with 108, all accomplishments are attained.

analyzed: paṃcāśadbhiḥ kāmya siddhiḥ syāt tathā catur uttaraiḥ
translated: With 50, the desired accomplishments will be attained, and likewise with 41.

analyzed: sarvathāḥ saptaviṃśatyā paṃcādasya abhicārake
translated: In all cases, with 27, the 5th one is for black magic.

analyzed: pañcaviṃśatibhiḥ mokṣam triṃśadbhiḥ dhana siddhaye
translated: With 25, for liberation, with 30, for the attainment of wealth.

analyzed: śilpinam toṣayitvā ca mālām kuryāt vicakṣaṇaḥ
translated: Having pleased the artisan, the wise one should make the rosary.

analyzed: sūtram ca api caturthehni kṣālayet tāla vāriṇā
translated: And the thread should be washed on the fourth day with water from the palm.

analyzed: samāna varṇa sūtreṣu graṃthayet śruti maṃtrakaiḥ
translated: In threads of the same color, one should tie with the Shruti mantras.

analyzed: vrahmagranthim tatas dadyāt nāgapāśam atha api vā
translated: Then one should make the Brahma knot, or also the Naga-pasha.

analyzed: vadhnīyāt dogdhrī vījena dvi sūtreṇa merum caret
translated: One should tie with the Dhogri bija, and perform the Meru with two threads.

analyzed: graṃthayet śruti vījena pratiṣṭhām ācaret tatas
translated: One should string it with the mantra of the Veda and then perform the installation.

analyzed: sūtra vidhim atas vakṣye nivodha tvam dvijarṣabha
translated: I will tell you the method of the thread, listen, O best of the twice-born.
The means beginning with the dharma of cotton is the bestower of all accomplishments.

analyzed: tat tu vipra indra kanyābhiḥ nirmitam ca su sobhanam
translated: That is well-made by the daughters of the best of Brahmins.

original: śuklaṃ kṛṣṇaṃ tathā raktaṃ paṭṭasūtramathāpi vā //
analyzed: śuklam kṛṣṇam tathā raktam paṭṭasūtram atha api vā
translated: White, black, and also red, or a silk thread.

analyzed: śānti vaśyā abhicāreṣu mokṣa aiśvarya jayeṣu ca
translated: In pacifying, enthralling, and exorcisms, in liberation, sovereignty, and victory,

original: śuklaṃ raktaṃ tathā pītaṃ kṛṣṇaṃ varṇeṣu ca kramāt //
analyzed: śuklam raktam tathā pītam kṛṣṇam varṇeṣu ca kramāt
translated: White, red, and also yellow, black, in the colors in order.

analyzed: sarveṣām eva varṇānām raktam sarva īpsita pradam
translated: For all the castes, red gives all that is desired.

analyzed: triguṇam triguṇī kṛtya grathayet śilpa śāstrataḥ
translated: Having tripled it, one should string it according to the science of crafts.

original: mukhe mukhaṃ tu saṃyojya puchepuchaṃ tu yojayet /
analyzed: mukhe mukham tu saṃyojya puche pucham tu yojayet
translated: Joining the head to the head, one should join the tail to the tail.

analyzed: go pucha sadṛśī mālā yat vā sarpa ākṛtiḥ bhavet
translated: The garland should resemble a cow's tail or be in the form of a snake.

analyzed: evam nirmāya vai mālām pratiṣṭhām ācaret vudhaḥ
translated: Having thus made the garland, the wise one should perform the installation.

analyzed: apratiṣṭhitābhiḥ mālābhiḥ maṃtram japati yaḥ naraḥ
translated: If a man recites the mantra with garlands that are not installed,

original: sarvaṃ tanniṣphalaṃ viṃdyāt kruddhā bhavati devatā /
analyzed: sarvam tat niṣphalam viṃdyāt kruddhā bhavati devatā
translated: all that should be known as fruitless, the deity becomes angry.

analyzed: aśvattha patra navakaiḥ padma ākāram tu kārayet
translated: One should make it in the shape of a lotus with nine leaves of the holy fig tree.

analyzed: tad madhye sthāpayet mālām mātṛkāḥ mūlam uccaran
translated: In the middle of that, one should place the garland, reciting the root mantra of the Mātṛkās.

analyzed: kṣālayet paṃcagavyena sadyojātena tad jalaiḥ
translated: One should wash it with the five products of the cow, and with the water of the Sadyojāta mantra.

analyzed: sadyojātena manunā kṣālayet vāribhiḥ dvija
translated: O Brahmin, one should wash it with water with the Sadyojāta mantra.

analyzed: candana aguru gaṃdha ādyaiḥ vāmadevena gharṣayet
translated: One should rub it with sandalwood, aloe, and other fragrances with the Vāmadeva mantra.

original: dhūpayet tāmaghoreṇa tatpuruṣeṇa lepayet /🔽maṃtrayetpaṃcame naiva pratyekaṃ tu śataṃ śatam //
analyzed: dhūpayet tām aghoreṇa tatpuruṣeṇa lepayet  maṃtrayet paṃcame nā eva pratyekam tu śatam śatam
translated: One should fumigate it with the Aghora mantra, and smear it with the Tatpuruṣa mantra.🔽One should consecrate it with the fifth mantra, one hundred times for each.

original: paṃcame naiva sūktena śatānyūnena maṃtrayet /🔽tatrāvāhya yajeddevīṃ tato vibhavavistaraiḥ //
analyzed: paṃcame na eva sūktena śatāni ūnena maṃtrayet  tatra āvāhya yajet devīm tatas vibhava vistaraiḥ
translated: With the fifth mantra, one should consecrate it with less than one hundred recitations.🔽Having invoked the Goddess there, one should worship her with one's wealth and in detail.

original: saṃskṛtyaivaṃ vudho mālāṃ tat prāṇāstatra sthāpayet /
analyzed: saṃskṛtya evam vudhaḥ mālām tat prāṇāḥ tatra sthāpayet
translated: Having thus consecrated the garland, the wise one should establish the vital breaths there.

analyzed: vāṇīvījam ca akṣa ādi mālikām tatas
translated: The seed of speech, the Praṇava, and then the garland beginning with the Aksha.

analyzed: daṇḍa varṇa antāḥ maṃtreṇa anena pūjayet
translated: One should worship with this mantra, ending with the word namas.

analyzed: homa karma tatas kuryāt devatāḥ bhāva siddhaye
translated: Then one should perform the homa rite for the accomplishment of the deity's essence.

analyzed: aṣṭottaraśatam hutvā saṃpāta ājyam vinikṣipet
translated: Having offered one hundred and eight oblations, one should pour the sacrificial ladle.

analyzed: homa karmaṇi aśaktaḥ ced dviguṇam japam ācaret
translated: If one is unable to perform the homa rite, one should do double the japa.

original: nānyamaṃtraṃ japenmaṃtrī kaṃpayennavidhūnayet /🔽kaṃpanāt siddhihāniḥ syād dhūnanaṃ vahuduḥkhadam //
analyzed: na anya maṃtram japet maṃtrī kaṃpayet na vidhūnayet  kaṃpanāt siddhi hāniḥ syāt dhūnanam vahu duḥkha dam
translated: The reciter of mantras should not recite any other mantra, should not shake or wave it.🔽By shaking, there will be loss of accomplishment, and waving brings much suffering.

original: śavde jāte bhaved rogaḥ karabhraṣṭo vināśakṛṃt /
analyzed: śavde jāte bhavet rogaḥ kara bhraṣṭaḥ vināśa kṛnt
translated: If there is a sound, there will be illness. If it falls from the hand, it brings destruction.

original: chinne sūtre bhaven mṛtyustasmād yatnaparo bhavet //
analyzed: chinne sūtre bhavet mṛtyuḥ tasmāt yatna paraḥ bhavet
translated: If the thread is cut, there will be death. Therefore, one should be very careful.

analyzed: tvam māle iti maṃtreṇa prapūjya sādhaka agraṇī
translated: Obeying the mantra You, O garland, the foremost of adepts,

analyzed: gopayet yatnatas vipra mālām parama mukti dām
translated: should carefully keep the garland, O Brahmin, which bestows supreme liberation.

original: jīrṇe sūtre punaḥ sūtraṃ grathayitvā punarjapet /🔽pramādātpatite hastā chatamaṣṭottaraṃ japet //
analyzed: jīrṇe sūtre punar sūtram grathayitvā punar japet  pramādāt patite śatam aṣṭa uttaram japet
translated: If the thread is worn out, one should again string it and repeat the mantra.🔽If it falls from the hand through carelessness, one should repeat the mantra one hundred and eight times.

analyzed: japet niṣiddha saṃsparśe kṣālayitvā yathocitam
translated: If it comes in contact with something forbidden, one should wash it as appropriate and repeat the mantra.

analyzed: iti te kathitam sarvam siddhi lakṣmyā arcana ucitam
translated: Thus, I have told you everything suitable for the worship of Siddhi Lakshmi.

analyzed: sarveṣām eva manunām ekaḥ eva pūjā vidhiḥ
translated: The method of worship is the same for all mantras.

analyzed: ṣoḍaśyāḥ pūjane dhyāna bheda mātram śṛṇu dvija

translated: The milking rhythm, the stick offering, the scripture, and the box,🔽Along with desire, the drying one, the head, the swing, the goad, and the two victories.🔽The lotus feet of the one who is to be worshipped by Brahma, Vishnu, and Shiva,

original: nṛmuṇḍāvalī bhūṣitagale saṃvodhanaṃ padam //🔽nikhilasurāsurarāsajya mahāvale tataḥ param /
analyzed: nikhila sura asura rāsajya mahā vale tatas param

analyzed: dogdhrī tālam namaḥ svāhā jaya yugma mahā mune
translated: Salutations to the milking rhythm, Svāhā, and the two pairs of victories, O great sage.

analyzed: satya yuge pratyaṃgire jaya dvaṃdvam tata smṛtam
translated: In the Satya Yuga, the two pairs of victories are remembered as Pratyangira.

analyzed: tretā yuge siddhi lakṣmī jaya dvayam atas param

analyzed: dvāpara yuge rāja lakṣmi jayadvaṃdam pare smṛtam
translated: In the Dvapara Yuga, the two pairs of victories are remembered as Rajya Lakshmi.

analyzed: kali yuge caṇḍa kāpālini tad param eva ca
translated: In the Kali Yuga, the two pairs of victories are remembered as Chandakapaalini.

original: śrutivāṇī valadā ca medhinakrau tataḥ param /
analyzed: śrutivāṇī valadā ca medhi nakrau tatas param
translated: Then, Salutations to the speech of the Vedas, the giver of strength, and the two - Medha and Krodha.

analyzed: prasphura yugalam ca api caṭa dvayam tatas smṛtam

analyzed: pracaṭa yugalam ca api gāya hasa yugam yugam

original: nṛtyayugaṃ kahayugaṃ ki / yugaṃ tataḥ param //

analyzed: tvara dhāva yugam ca eva yugam dogdhrī śivaḥ tathā

analyzed: dolāṃkuśam caṭī ca eva vyomakeśi padam tatas

analyzed: śiraḥ dolā aṃkuśa caṭyau bhagamālini tat param

analyzed: bhaga prade bhaga priye tāla homau dogdhrī tatas

analyzed: śiraḥ dolā aṃkuśa caṭyau madana unmādini tatas

analyzed: śava māṃsa khādini vrahma saṃvādini tatas
translated: Śava-māṃsa-khādini, brahma-saṃvādinī, then,

analyzed: phaṭ svahā hum śiraḥ ca eva dolā aṃkuśam caṭī tathā

analyzed: saṃsāra sāgara taraṇe padam eva ca

analyzed: tribhuvana nandina caraṇe phaṭ svāhā tatas

Kara-tālikā trāṣita-tripiṣṭaye mahā-mune,

analyzed: mahāsaṃvartta kālī
translated: The time of the great dissolution, and also the outstretched dance.

analyzed: pāda āghāta parivartita sapta dvīpe tat param  tāla homau caṭīdogdhrī śiraḥ dolā aṃkuśaḥ tathā  caṭī caraṇa vinyāsā padāt anu
translated: In the seven islands turned by the beating of feet, beyond that.🔽The palm, the homa, the chati, the milker, the head, the swing, the goad, and likewise.🔽The placement of the chati foot, and then the bent foot.

translated: The phaṭ, svāhā, huṃ, the form of the swing, the goad, and the chati, likewise.

analyzed: duḥkha traya ati bhūta jaṃgamā jaṃgamā iti ca
translated: The one who is beyond the three kinds of suffering, the moving and unmoving, and likewise.

analyzed: tad param sakala satva tāriṇi tat anantaram

analyzed: deva adhideva hṛdaya aravinda prakāśana iti api

translated: Having accomplished the siddhi, then, O Brahmin, in the orb of the one sun.

analyzed: tāla homau śrutiḥ vāṇī caṭī siddhi bhuvaḥ tathā

analyzed: sukha dā samīhāḥ tad anaṃtaram

analyzed: pravaṃdha śoṣiṇī dolā sṛṇiśiraḥ sakhī tathā

analyzed: sakala daitya dānava asura yakṣa rākṣasa iti api
translated: And also the words demons, goblins, yakshas, rakshasas,

analyzed: tatas  vaśīkaraṇa dveṣa uccāṭana āpadam atas param
translated: And then the words country, disturbance, paralysis, infatuation,🔽 And then the words subjugation, enmity, expulsion,

analyzed: dvipada catuṣpada ṣaṭpāda aṣṭapada iti ca
translated: And then the words terrestrial, aquatic, biped, quadruped, six-legged, eight-legged,

analyzed: aneka pada ghorām dhakāra iti tat anusmaret
translated: Then one should remember the terrible word dhakāra with many syllables.
Then the word sarvapada (all words) that harms the great epidemic, the seizure of the mouth, and all.

analyzed: sva apahāri māyāḥ viduḥ jana ākṣepi tat param
translated: The wise ones know the word svāpahāri (remover of sleep) that casts away the people.

analyzed: devi dasyu vañcaka ādi vā acara padam tatas

Then the word śṛṅgī (horned) with its own syllables rātriñcara (moving in the night), sandhyācara (moving in the twilight).

analyzed: daṃṣṭi ledi vividha upadrave tatas

analyzed: prasīda dvayam anukaṃpaya yugam tatas ca nārada

analyzed: śatrūn jahi yugalam unmūla yugam tatas

analyzed: nāśaya yugalam ca api hana dvayam mahā mune

analyzed: uccāṭaya yugam ca api staṃbhaya yugalam tatas

analyzed: trāsaya dvaṃdam mohaya dvaṃdam vidrāvaya dvayam tatas
translated: Then the two words trāsayā (frighten) and mohay

analyzed: hana yugam bhakṣaya yugam kṛṃtaya yugalam tatas

analyzed: pātaya yugam kaṃpaya yugam udvejaya yugam tatas

analyzed: āveśaya yugam ca api unmādaya yugam tathā

analyzed: bhujaṃga kinkinīke ca kavaṃdha vījam tatas param

analyzed: pātāla vāsini tadā nava vīja aṃtar cāriṇi
translated: Then Patala-vasini, then the seed syllable moving inside,🔽Kokamukhi, the seed syllable, then Rakta-tundin,

translated: Dogdhri Rudradhara, and then Dogdhri Rkshkani,

analyzed: hu jāri tadanu vidyut hāse tatas param
translated: Hujjari, then Vidyuddhasi, then after that,

analyzed: hu candrabhāle tadanu śavari tatas param

analyzed: hu rājya aiśvarya dāyini rājarāja īśvari tatas

analyzed: hu maṇi dhari vajrini hu mahā ḍāmari padam

analyzed: hu bhakti sevā pūraṇe   caturvarga phala prade
translated: Hūṃ for fulfilling devotion and service, and hūṃ for granting the fruits of the four goals.

analyzed: dogdhrī vījam tatas tāram tatas advaite mukti padam

analyzed: siddhi dāpaya svāhā tāram turīya atīte padam  sva padam darśaya svāhā tatas tāram mahā mune

analyzed: om nāda vindu svarūpe ca yogam prakaṭaya svāhā

analyzed: om caitanya maya ākāre sarvajña tām prakalpaya
translated: Oṃ, in the form of pure consciousness, grant omniscience.

analyzed: padam eva ca

analyzed: śabdavrahma mayi tadā sarva vidyām mayi tatas

analyzed: avasthāpaya tatas svāhā śrutivījam ca nārada
translated: establish it, then svāhā, and the seed of the Vedas, O Nārada.

analyzed: tatas saṃsāra dāva agni rūpa idam tatas padam
translated: Then, in the form of the forest fire of worldly existence, then this state,

analyzed: janma mṛtyum apanaya svāhā om bhakta vatsale

analyzed: durgatim mā īśa maya svāhā tāram ca nārada
translated: Oṃ, remove me from misfortune, svāhā. And also the Tārā mantra and Nārāyaṇa.

analyzed: trayī svarūpini tathā pāpāt unmocaya svāhā
translated: Oṃ, to the one who is of the form of the three Vedas, and also liberate me from sin, svāhā.

analyzed: om tvayi bhaktim vitara iti api

analyzed: homaḥ tāram tatas sarva abhiprāya vedini tatas
translated: The homa mantra is Oṃ, to the one who knows all intentions, svāhā.

analyzed: tatas trivargeṇa mām yojaya iti homaḥ tathā
translated: Then, Oṃ, please connect me with the three goals, and the homa mantra is likewise.

analyzed: om prasāda su mukhi svāhā
translated: Oṃ, O you who are kind and have a pleasing face, please satisfy me with boons, svāhā.🔽Oṃ, to the one who is the lion of the Vedas, forests, and scriptures, and also to my sense of ownership.

original: oṃ nigamāgamāraṇya siṃhi mamatāṃ tataḥ param //🔽haṃtāmapanuda svāhā tāraṃ navākṣarī tataḥ /

analyzed: niraṃjanā nirīhā ca niḥsaṃgā anirguṇā tatas

analyzed: samasta sākṣiṇī sarva bhūta nigūḍhā ca

analyzed: tatas sarveśvarī sarva ārādhyā

analyzed: satva guṇa mayī pādam sa parivṛṃhaṇā tatas

analyzed: samadarśanā tadanu tattvam asi śruti dvayam

analyzed: kūṭasthā kalanā varjitā kalpanā tatas

analyzed: rahitā kāraṇātītā karmā sahacarī tathā

analyzed: kevala anubhava vedyā tattvami tatas param

analyzed: śruti dvayam niṣprapaṃcā śuddha vuddhā iti tad param

analyzed: tattvam asi śruti dvayam nitya jñāna ichā tat param

analyzed: kṛti mahodaya iti ca nivṛtti padam eva ca

analyzed: upādhi ahaṃkāra manaḥ vāsanā padam eva ca

analyzed: yoni citta vuddhi nisarga hīnā tat tvam asi ca

analyzed: śruti dvayam tatas eva hi
translated: The two statements That thou art are the means of knowledge and the object of knowledge, because of that.

analyzed: sattā parama artha śūkṣmā bhāsa nimitta padāt param

analyzed: śruti dvayam sat asat upaśama iti tad param

analyzed: tat tvam asi śruti dvayam yāvat eka nirguṇa iti ca
translated: The two statements That thou art are up to the one without qualities.

analyzed: tattvam iti āra dvaṃdvam vācya vācaka padam tatas

analyzed: bhāva siddha śiva śakti samaya iti tatas param

analyzed: rahasya saṃpradāyinī tattvam asi tatas param
translated: The secret tradition - beyond that is That thou art.

analyzed: niśreya apavarga mokṣa nayā iti tat param
translated: Niśreya, Apavarga, and Mokṣa. That is supreme.

analyzed: ye padam eva ca
translated: The one who is in Sāmarasya, the one who is in Pratyagā, the one who is in Pada,

analyzed: nanda anubhava tādātmya ādi paryāya padam tatas
